elements.title: St Collen's Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that St Collen's Church (pictured) in Wales has a memorial to one of the 19th century's most famous same-sex partnerships?

elements.title: Fabian Kelly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fabian Kelly, a tenor focused on historically informed performance, was a soloist in Monteverdi's Vespro della Beata Vergine and Handel's Messiah?

elements.title: its employees' credit union (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Superior Coach Company closed in 1981, its employees' credit union absorbed 15 other credit unions to become the fourth-largest in Ohio?

elements.title: William Thomas Sugg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Thomas Sugg's firm installed the gas lights on Tower Bridge?

elements.title: The Hidden Case of Ewan Forbes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Hidden Case of Ewan Forbes discusses the history of transgender man Ewan Forbes and his 1968 legal case to inherit his family's baronetcy that was silenced from public records?

elements.title: Maximilian Dood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Digital Eclipse expressed interest in rereleasing Marvel vs. Capcom 2 after Maximilian Dood's social media campaign went viral?

elements.title: John Halle's Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the medieval John Halle's Hall is the foyer of a cinema?

elements.title: Paramount Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to celebrate the Paramount Building's construction, oxen and lamb were roasted over the ruins of the previous building on the site?
